title: 104_s1559
content:
The "Bankruptcy Technical Corrections Act of 1996" may be cited as the short title for this Act. It includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to reorder and redefine terms alphabetically, adjust definitions for insured depository institutions, and add headings to each paragraph. The terms in Section 101 of title 11, United States Code are redefined alphabetically, adjusted for insured depository institutions, and have headings added to each paragraph. Additionally, changes include inserting "The term" after each paragraph heading, removing semicolons at the end of paragraphs, and replacing "and" with a period at the end of specific paragraphs. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. 

SEC. 4. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``, or the debtor's attorney'' after ``1103'' in paragraph (1), and by striking ``(3)(A) In'' and inserting ``(3) In'' in paragraph (3).

SEC. 5. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``of the estate'' after ``property'' the first place it appears.

SEC. 6. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. SEC. 6. EXECUTORY CONTRACTS AND UNEXPIRED LEASES. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to streamline and simplify certain subsections and paragraphs. SEC. 9. EXEMPTIONS. Amends Section 522 of title 11, United States Code. SEC. 10. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Amends Section 523(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code. SEC. 11. PROTECTION AGAINST DISCRIMINATORY TREATMENT. SEC. 11. Protection against discriminatory treatment in student grants and programs under title 11, United States Code, is amended to include specific language adjustments. SEC. 14. Liability of transferee of avoided transfer amended to clarify recoveries from non-insider transferees. Conforming amendment made to Section 547(b) of title 11, United States Code. SEC. 15. Setoff. SEC. 15. Setoff. Section 553(b)(1) is amended by changing "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)". Section 726(b) is amended by removing "1009,". Section 901(a) is amended by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". Section 1226(b)(2) is amended by replacing references to "1202(c) of this title" with "586(b) of title 28" and "1202(d) of this title" with "586(e)(1)(B) of title 28". Section 1228 is amended by replacing "1222(b)(10)" with "1222(b)(9)". SEC. 20. Contents of plan amended in subsection (b) and (e). SEC. 21. Discharge amended in section 1328(a) for specified debts. SEC. 22. Bankruptcy Review Commission. SEC. 22 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 is amended by removing subsection (g) and redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (g). SEC. 23 amends Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code, regarding the appointment of a trustee. If an eligible trustee is elected at a creditors' meeting, the United States trustee must certify the election. Any dispute arising from the election will be resolved by the court. SEC. 24 of the Bankruptcy Act of 1986 is amended to extend certain deadlines from October 1, 2002, to October 1, 2012, and from October 1, 2003, to October 1, 2013. SEC. 25 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, US Code, regarding bankruptcy law. SEC. 26 modifies Section 1334(d) of title 28, US Code, related to bankruptcy cases. SEC. 27 updates Section 362(b)(1) of title 11, US Code, concerning child support enforcement. SEC. 28 introduces a limitation. SEC. 28 introduces a limitation on the exemption of property under State or local law for debtors, capping the aggregate interest at $500,000 for certain types of property. The United States Code is amended to grant exclusive authority to the district court to review the expenses of a standing trustee upon request. The court must defer to the Attorney General's determination and can only reverse it if there is an abuse of discretion. Additionally, a provision is added to address cases where the United States Trustee stops assigning cases. The trustee appointed under section 586(b) of title 28 can seek judicial review in the district court if the United States Trustee stops assigning cases. The court must give substantial deference to the Trustee's decision and can only reverse it if there is an abuse of discretion. Interim relief can be ordered by the court only if there was no basis for the Trustee's decision. SEC. 30. EFFECTIVE DATE OF AMENDMENTS. The amendments made by this Act apply to pending cases on or after the date of enactment, with an exception for cases commenced after enactment.
